title: Design Thinking-Based Social Innovation Workshop for Sustainable Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic design thinking processes and understanding of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
context.additional_context: A project-based learning course for in-service practitioners conducted in smartphone-based mobile environments, where learners develop sustainable solutions for community problems and promote peer learning through learning-teaching-based pedagogy

learning_goals: Learners can develop prototypes to solve community issues linked to Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by applying design thinking methodologies
Learners can design collaborative solutions while sharing knowledge with peers through learning-teaching based pedagogical approaches
Learners can strengthen practical application skills by iteratively conducting a 3-day intensive workshop (Social Innovation Jam) in mobile microlearning environments

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Docs, Miro)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
